title: Deprecate the Prysm Remote Signer in favor of Web3signer interface

labels.name: Discussion
labels.description: Simply a thread for talking about stuff

# ðŸ’Ž Issue

### Background

Prysm currently has integration for 2 types of remote signers
- Prysm Remote Signer, gRPC, developed in-house
- Web3signer, REST, developed by consensys

Web3signer's interface became the defacto standard remote signer among the consensus clients prior to the merge. Prysm Remote Signer was gRPC-based it was not adopted by other clients. 

### Description
We propose deprecating Prysm Remote Signer during Prysm v4
Since the merge support for Prysm's Remote Signer has fallen by the wayside, we provide a POC of the remote signer for users to build on https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/remote-signer but has not been maintained since last September. Web3signer continues to be supported as a standard interface for remote signing in Ethereum. Learn more about its capabilities at https://docs.web3signer.consensys.net/en/latest/

Please use this issue to voice any concerns with this proposal.

These deprecation actions should include:

- Deprecate the prysm remote wallet keymanager type
- Removal of the Prysm Remote Keymanager type from the Prysm repo
- Deprecate related flags for Prysm Remote Signer
- Add 2-way TSL support to web3signer hook for Prysm Remote Signer feature parody #9994 
- Deprecate the Remote Signer Poc https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/remote-signer repo
